description:
Hello,

we have a openstack setup with 4 hosts, folsom, all of them kvm and ubuntu 12.04 LTS (packages from ubuntu-cloud.archive). Resize to same host is enabled and multi_host is true. We use nova-network instead of quantum.

Tried the following three times:
1. launch a instance
2. associated a floating ip to it 
3. do a resize. 
4. access the machine (does not work)

With every resize the host providing the vm changes and i think thats the problem:
The iptables rules for NAT stay on both, the old and the new host. Even after half an hour that is the case. After a "service nova-network restart" everything works fine.
If i try a ping i am able to see the request at the old host but there is no response to it because the vm is not there anymore. Same problem with ssh.

Do you think this is a bug or is it not allowed to do a resize with associated floating ip?
title: after resize floating ip stays on old host

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~b-von-st-vieth

comments.content:
This is a known issue in folsom. You have to disassociate the ip before resize and reassociate it after

http://wiki.openstack.org/ReleaseNotes/Folsom#OpenStack_Compute_.28Nova.29

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1053344

It is fixed in grizzly.

Sorry for the inconvenience.
